data.title: Don't miss the target
data.solution:
n = int(input())
a = int(input())
for i in range(a):
    p_i = int(input())
    p_hit = 1-(p_i/100)**n
    print(f"{100 * p_hit:.2f}%")
data.statement:
Let [[p]] be the <<probability>> that an archer <<misses>> a shot.
You are given many [[p]]-s, related to as many different archers.
For each of them, <<evaluate the probability>> that they <<will hit>> the target <<at least once>> in <<n shots>>.

Probability of missing the target is provided as an <<integer percentage>>.
The <<answer>>, the probability to hit the target at least once, will be provided as a <<float percentage>> with <<2>> decimals, rounded to the nearest one, <<followed by the '%' sign>>.

Notice: there is a probability formula to compute this. Do not forget to put probabilities in interval [<<0.0>>, <<1.0>>] for calculations and to provide output probabilities in the interval [<<0.00>>, <<100.00>>]<<%>>.
data.constraints:
2 <= [[n]] <= 30, integer, the number of shots
1 <= [[a]] <= 10, integer, the number of archers
1 <= [[p]] <= 99, integer, the probability (percentage) of missing the target
data.stubGenerator:
read n:int
read a:int
loop a read pi:int
loop a write hit-probability for i-th archer
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1>>: [[n]], the number of shots for each archer
<<Line 2>>: [[a]], the number of archers
<<Next>> {{a}} <<Lines>>: [[p]](i), the probability that the i-th archer misses each shot
data.outputDescription: '{{a}}' lines containing the probability of hitting the target at least once for each archer, in the same order than provided on input.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Let p be the probability that an archer misses a shot.
You are given many p-s, related to as many different archers.
For each of them, evaluate the probability that they will hit the target at least once in n shots.

Probability of missing the target is provided as an integer percentage.
The answer, the probability to hit the target at least once, will be provided as a float percentage with 2 decimals, rounded to the nearest one, followed by the '%' sign.

Notice: there is a probability formula to compute this. Do not forget to put probabilities in interval [0.0, 1.0] for calculations and to provide output probabilities in the interval [0.00, 100.00]%.
Input
Line 1: n, the number of shots for each archer
Line 2: a, the number of archers
Next a Lines: p(i), the probability that the i-th archer misses each shot
Output
'a' lines containing the probability of hitting the target at least once for each archer, in the same order than provided on input.
Constraints
2 <= n <= 30, integer, the number of shots
1 <= a <= 10, integer, the number of archers
1 <= p <= 99, integer, the probability (percentage) of missing the target
Example
Input
3
1
75
Output
57.81%
